This Functor may help TIR fusion or inline multiple PrimFuncs

headline: [Pass] Fix printer formatting for PassInfo
body:
The format of the printed PassInfoNode was difficult to read as there
was no separation between the different attributes of the node

Before this change, PassInfo is printed as:
The meta data of the pass: pass name: tir.ApplyLayoutTransformsopt_level: 0required passes: [
]

After this change, PassInfo is printed as:
The meta data of the pass - pass name: tir.ApplyLayoutTransforms, opt_level: 0, required passes: []
author: quic-sanirudh
pr_title: [Pass] Fix printer formatting for PassInfo

headline: [Hexagon] Pass extra parameters to link_params via Map
body:
There is no way to pass kwargs dictionary from C++ code, so the previous
way never worked. Use TVM's Map instead, and pass the target architecture
version to the linker to use libraries specific to the architecture.

headline: [ci][docker] Remove nvidia ml repository before updating
body:
`bash docker/build.sh ci_gpu` fails locally as well as in CI: https://ci.tlcpack.ai/blue/organizations/jenkins/docker-images-ci%2Fdaily-docker-image-rebuild/detail/daily-docker-image-rebuild/273/pipeline/57

From [this post](https://forums.developer.nvidia.com/t/failed-to-fetch-https-developer-download-nvidia-com-compute-machine-learning-repos-ubuntu1804-x86-64-packages-gz/156287), so long as the build completes (meaning we don't use any images from this repo), it should be fine

headline: [REFACTOR] Remove legacy nnvm folder
body:
nnvm was the first generation IR that was maintained by TVM before the community moved to a newer generation.
The community keeps it for a few more releases(v0.7 and v0.8).

This PR removes the folder. The source code can still be found in past releases.
author: tqchen
pr_title: [REFACTOR] Remove legacy nnvm folder

headline: Resolve breakage, treat {} and {0} as start of any array.
body:
When constructing a buffer, if `elem_offsets` is either `{}` or
`{0}` (the default values for the two constructors), treat as the
start of the array with correct dimensionality.
author: Lunderberg
pr_title: [TIR] Allow multiple element offsets in Buffer

headline: [CUBLAS] Add cuBLAS as a Relay partitioning target (BYOC)
body:
This PR adds a partitioning pass for cuBLAS so that
supported Relay patterns can be offloaded to cuBLAS.

This initial commit only adds offloading support
for nn.matmul.

Although cuBLAS is already enabled in TVM by using
strategy selection in TE, by exposing it explicitly
as a Relay partitioning target we can more precisely
describe how to execute a model in Relay. This is
desirable particularly in the Collage effort to
improve multi-backend graph partitioning.
author: mbaret
pr_title: [CUBLAS] Add cuBLAS as a Relay partitioning target (BYOC)

  `offset_factors`, which required only minor updates to maintain
  existing behavior.

pr_title: [TIR] Allow multiple element offsets in Buffer

headline: Updated TVMScript parser and printer
author: Lunderberg
pr_title: [TIR] Allow multiple element offsets in Buffer

headline: Update python calls, with backwards compatibility
body:
- `Buffer.elem_offset` and `Buffer.offset_factor` are implemented as
  properties, to avoid breakage of calling code.

- `decl_buffer` handles single or multiple `elem_offset` and
  `offset_factor` parameters.  The parameter name is unchanged, to
  avoid breaking call sites that use named arguments.
author: Lunderberg
pr_title: [TIR] Allow multiple element offsets in Buffer

headline: Updates to Buffer class, to handle multiple elem_offsets
body:
- Includes size checks to ensure that each parameter that depends
  on the number of physical dimensions (`elem_offsets`,
  `offset_factors`, and `axis_separators`) are consistent.

- Support previous Buffer constructor with a single `elem_offset` and
  `offset_factor`, delegating to the array-based constructor.
author: Lunderberg
pr_title: [TIR] Allow multiple element offsets in Buffer

headline: [TIR] Allow multiple element offsets in BufferNode
body:
Follow-up from https://github.com/apache/tvm/pull/9727.  When using
`Stage.tensorize`, the element offset of the array view has one offset
for each physical dimension of the buffer.  This change replaces
`BufferNode::elem_offset` and `BufferNode::offset_factor` with arrays.
author: Lunderberg
pr_title: [TIR] Allow multiple element offsets in Buffer

headline: [TE] Correctly generate buffer binds with axis separators
body:
In SchedulePostProcToPrimfunc, when the axis separator attribute is
moved to the buffer properties, it doesn't update buffers that are in
the buffer bind scope.  This occurs if `Stage.tensorize` is called for
a stage whose layout transformation includes `te.AXIS_SEPARATOR`.
author: Lunderberg
pr_title: [TE] Update buffer binds if axis separators exist

headline: [Hexagon] Distinguish between 1-d buffer and single-alloc 2-d buffer
body:
Previously, HexagonBuffer represented 1-d buffers as 2-d buffers with
`nallocs==1`.  Since this is used to determine the return type of the
data pointer exposed to the generated code, the ambiguity between
`shape=[N]` and `shape=[1,N]` must be avoided.  This commit replaces
`HexagonBuffer::nallocs_` with `HexagonBuffer::ndim_`, avoiding this
ambiguity.
author: Lunderberg
pr_title: [Hexagon] Support both 1-d and 2-d VTCM allocations

headline: [ci] Add GitHub Actions bot to merge PRs on demand
body:
This implements https://discuss.tvm.apache.org/t/rfc-allow-merging-via-pr-comments/12220. The bot can be invoked from a top-level review comment or via a regular PR comment. The text `@tvm-bot merge` anywhere in the body will trigger the bot. Right now it checks that the latest commit is reviewed and that all CI jobs that have run on that commit are successful. If it fails, it will leave a comment on the PR with the reason.

This is just a start and some features are left for followups:
* Various TODOs throughout the code
* "Scheduled" merges that happen once CI finishes
* Allowing committers to merge without getting a fresh review for changes after an approval
author: driazati
pr_title: Rev2

headline: [ci] Add GitHub Actions bot to merge PRs on demand
body:
This implements https://discuss.tvm.apache.org/t/rfc-allow-merging-via-pr-comments/12220. The bot can be invoked from a top-level review comment or via a regular PR comment. The text `@tvm-bot merge` anywhere in the body will trigger the bot. Right now it checks that the latest commit is reviewed and that all CI jobs that have run on that commit are successful. If it fails, it will leave a comment on the PR with the reason.

This is just a start and some features are left for followups:
* Various TODOs throughout the code
* "Scheduled" merges that happen once CI finishes
* Allowing committers to merge without getting a fresh review for changes after an approval
author: driazati
pr_title: [ci] Add GitHub Actions bot to merge PRs on demand

headline: [Hexagon] Support both 1-d and 2-d VTCM allocations
body:
Previously, all VTCM allocations were assumed to be 2-d buffers.  This
commit extends `HexagonDeviceAPIv2::AllocVtcmWorkspace` to allow both
1-d and 2-d VTCM allocations.  Matching the semantics used in
`CodeGenHexagon::CreateBufferPtr`, allocation of 1-d buffers returns a
`void*`, and allocation of 2-d buffers returns a `void**`.

Co-authored-by: Adam Straw <astraw@octoml.ai>
author: Lunderberg
pr_title: [Hexagon] Support both 1-d and 2-d VTCM allocations

headline: [PROFILING] Add Likwid Metric Collector
body:
Likwid is a library for reading performance counters. Unlike PAPI it
supports more sophisticated metrics calculated from a combination of
performance counters. This includes memory bandwidth and total floating
point operations. Likwid also supports some platforms not supported by
PAPI.

Two MetricCollectors are provided: LikwidMetricCollector and
LikwidMarkerMetricCollector. The former adds the requested metric group
to the profiling report. The latter adds no information on its own, but
can be used in combination with the `likwid-perfctr` command line tool
to report different metrics at runtime.

MetricCollectors can now specify if they support nested regions (likwid
does not) and can provide metrics after profiling is done using the
`Finish` interface. MetricCollectors are also provided with a `CallId`
on every start to correlate metrics with a given call in `Finish`.
author: tkonolige
pr_title: [PROFILING] Add Likwid Metric Collector
